item.title: Black Myth: Wukong Physical Edition Launches for PS5 in December
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/black-myth-wukong-physical-release-date

The physical version of celebrated action RPG Black Myth: Wukong finally has a release date, so mark your calendar if you've been waiting to check this one out on disc.

Per a post on X (formerly Twitter) by physical game company PM Studios, the physical version of Black Myth: Wukong arrives on PS5 on December 12th. Naturally, the PC version's not getting a physical edition; after all, when was the last time your PC had an honest-to-goodness disc drive?

If you're worried that the physical version of the game will just be one of those empty-box-with-no-actual-disc-inside deals, you needn't be. PM Studios has confirmed that the box will, in fact, contain a proper disc, and not just a code.

The physical version of the game will contain a code for the Deluxe Edition upgrade, which will net you an extra staff and set of armor, as well as an additional curio. You can claim this equipment from the Keeper's Shrine menu.

If Black Myth: Wukong's physical launch is anything like as successful as the digital version was, then we can likely expect this release to break a couple more sales milestones, which will no doubt make developer GameScience happy.

If you're not familiar with Black Myth: Wukong, it's an action RPG developed by Chinese studio GameScience and based loosely on the classical novel Journey to the West.

Rather than Wukong himself, you control the Destined One, a distinctly simian warrior whose destiny is to follow in the footsteps of the legendary trickster god. Along the way, you'll meet plenty of colorful characters and visit lots of beautiful locations inspired by classical Chinese mythology.

Black Myth: Wukong is a Soulslike, so you can expect tough boss fights and plenty of semi-linear exploration, although the game goes a little easier on the difficulty than the likes of Elden Ring.

You can check out Black Myth: Wukong right now on PC and PlayStation 5. The physical version of the PS5 release is due to arrive on December 12th. If you're still on the fence, you can check out my review here.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Genshin Impact Version 5.2 Release Date and New Content Revealed
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/genshin-impact-version-52-release-date

HoYoverse has announced the Genshin Impact Version 5.2 release date, as well as what new characters and features you can expect when the update arrives.

Following on from last month's Version 5.1, Genshin Impact Version 5.2 officially arrives on November 20th, alongside the long-awaited Xbox Series X|S version of the game. There's still no word on when - or, at this point, whether - the game will be appearing on Switch, however.

In any case, Version 5.2 will introduce two new Saurians to get to grips with: Qucusaurs and Iktomisaurs. They'll help you to reach new areas, find hidden treasure, and even engage enemies in combat, and they'll be introduced alongside two new Natlan clans, the Flower-Feather Clan and the Masters of the Night Wind.

As you've probably guessed, this update's two new characters each hail from one of the above clans. Chasca, the Peacemaker of the Flower-Feather Clan, is a five-star Anemo bow user who can "float and attack mid-air".

She's joined by Ororon, a four-star bow user who wields the Electro element. He can deal damage, taunt enemies, and even boost your team's gliding speed, making him invaluable in exploration as well as combat.

Both characters will debut as part of the first half of Version 5.2's Event Wishes, alongside a rerun of Lyney. In the second half of the update's cycle, you can expect reruns of Zhongli and Neuvillette.

Naturally, you can also look forward to new story quests, a brand new boss to take on, and "an array of quality-of-life updates" to make your Genshin Impact gameplay experience smoother.

Don't worry; I haven't forgotten today's codes, either. Here's what you need to input to get some free stuff following today's Genshin Impact Special Program.

  • 100 Primogems, 10 Mystic Enhancement Ore: 6ALMWAVKLK35
  • 100 Primogems, 5 Hero's Wit: 7TLMXSD243JR
  • 100 Primogems, 50,000 Mora: JS45ETDJLKMD

Genshin Impact is available for free right now on PC, PlayStation, and mobile devices. The game, along with its 5.2 update, will be heading to Xbox Series X|S on November 20th.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Humankind Developer Amplitude Studios Splits from Sega and Goes Indie
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/amplitude-studios-sega-split-indie

Humankind and Endless Dungeon developer Amplitude Studios has announced that it's split from Sega and gone independent, with the studio describing the move as a return to its "roots".

In a post on Steam (which can be seen across all of Amplitude's games on the platform), Amplitude says its journey with Sega "has been amazing", but that ownership of the studio has returned "to some of our original founders and members of the team".

According to Amplitude, its parting with Sega happened on "good terms", and the studio remains committed to "working closely with our players", which it says is still very much at the "heart of our philosophy".

In the aforementioned Steam post, Amplitude founder Romain de Waubert de Genlis says the studio currently has two projects in development, describing them as "exciting", although he doesn't elaborate on what they might be.

He also says Amplitude is "backed by strong and meaningful franchises", and that the decision to go independent allows the studio to "be more agile in our approach".

Amplitude Studios was first founded back in 2011, with ex-Ubisoft staffers de Waubert de Genlis and Mathieu Girard setting up the company. The first game released by Amplitude was 2012's Endless Space, which kicked off the Endless series of strategy-focused games.

Said series continued with 2014's turn-based 4X game Endless Legend and tower defense roguelike Dungeon of the Endless, which was released in the same year. Following these releases, Sega snapped up Amplitude in 2016.

Amplitude's first game under Sega's wing was 2017's Endless Space 2, a followup to the developer's debut game, and that was followed up by an experimental visual novel, Love Thyself - A Horatio Story, which is again set in the Endless universe.

It wouldn't take long for Amplitude to return to strategy development, though, with 2021's Humankind (not to be confused with Ancestors: The Humankind Odyssey) attempting to rival Civilization in terms of scope and system complexity.

The studio's most recent project is Endless Dungeon, a successor to-come-reimagining of Dungeon of the Endless that features a new 3D art style and plenty of additional mechanics to wrap your brain around.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
